plan: To maximize long-term profit, I'll implement a dynamic bidding strategy. I'll initially bid conservatively slightly above average ($50-$60) to gather baseline data. In subsequent rounds, I'll test aggressive bids (around $70-$90) when my value is high, and low bids ($0-$30) to bluff or conserve resources when the value is low. I'll analyze rivals' patterns and adjust bids to undercut or exceed expected bids only when potential profit justifies the risk. Over time, I’ll fine-tune based on competitors' tendencies, leveraging any observable trends to estimate the “price to win” efficiently.

I will begin by testing aggressive strategies, initially bidding close to my value to maximize profit on a win. In early rounds, bid 80% of my value when over $50 to avoid overpaying but remain competitive. I'll explore underbidding in low-valued rounds to gather opponent data. I will adjust to tighter bids slightly below the average of recent winning bids to undercut others' expectations. Monitor opponents' trends or consistency to exploit predictable behaviors. Adapt progressively by shading bids slightly, enabling data collection on rivals' thresholds while consistently maximizing profits against varying strategies.

I will implement a mixed bidding strategy. Initially, bid conservatively just above my random value, ensuring minimal loss if I win but maximizing profit. In alternate rounds, aggressively bid close to or at the maximum ($99), regardless of my value, to explore competitors' upper limits and strategies. Track outcomes, noting winning thresholds and rivals' tendencies. Occasionally bid zero to observe others' bids without risking funds. Adapt subsequent bids based on observed patterns, aiming for bids that exceed Andy's and Betty's typical bids by $1-2, enhancing profitability. Continuously adjust aggression level based on profit trends and competitors' behaviors.

Next, I'll bid slightly above average if the value is high, targeting $60-$65; experiment with lower bids ($45-$50) for mid-range values to save for future rounds.
